headline: Riyadh Air and IBM Partner to Launch World's First AI-Native Airline
summary: At IBM Think Riyadh 2025, IBM (NYSE: IBM) and Riyadh Air announced a major milestone in their collaboration, unveiling Riyadh Air as the world's first AI-native airline. Designed from the ground up without legacy patch work, these AI-driven operations provide the foundation to transform guest and employee experiences and set a new benchmark for innovation in the aviation industry.

content.title: Riyadh Air and IBM Partner to Launch World's First AI-Native Airline
content.summary: At IBM Think Riyadh 2025, IBM (NYSE: IBM) and Riyadh Air announced a major milestone in their collaboration, unveiling Riyadh Air as the world's first AI-native airline. headline: Adobe (ADBE): Revisiting Valuation After Recent Share Price Rebound
summary: Adobe (ADBE) shares have been grinding higher over the past week, outpacing the broader software group even as the stock remains well below its highs, prompting investors to revisit its long term setup. See our latest analysis for Adobe. The latest 7 day share price return of 7.25 percent follows a weak year to date share price return of negative 21.48 percent and a one year total shareholder return of negative 36.81 percent, suggesting short term momentum is rebuilding from a much softer...

headline: Fed Rate Decision, Broadcom and Costco Earnings: What to Watch This Week
summary: The Federal Reserve will hold its last rate-setting meeting of 2025 this week. A few notable earnings are also due, including Broadcom, Oracle and Adobe, plus retailer Costco. Here's what to expect: Today   Earnings: Toll Brothers   Tomorrow  Earnings: AutoZone, Campbell’s, GameStop   Economic data: October job openings and labor turnover survey (JOLTS).

headline: Analysts' 'AI Loser' List Points To Risks For Uber, Adobe, Intel And These Tech Players
summary: While AI stocks are in the Wall Street spotlight, Wedbush analysts on Monday pointed to "AI losers."  "As we look to identify the winners in the 4th industrial revolution driven by artificial intelligence, we are cognizant of amplified disruption from tectonic shifts in behavior across enterprises and consumers," Wedbush analyst led by Seth Basham said in a client note.  The report also coincided with Wedbush analyst downgrades of Pinterest and software firm Nice Systems to neutral, from prior outperform ratings for both.

content.title: Analysts' 'AI Loser' List Points To Risks For Uber, Adobe, Intel And These Tech Players
content.summary: While AI stocks are in the Wall Street spotlight, Wedbush analysts on Monday pointed to "AI losers."  "As we look to identify the winners in the 4th industrial revolution driven by artificial intelligence, we are cognizant of amplified disruption from tectonic shifts in behavior across enterprises and consumers," Wedbush analyst led by Seth Basham said in a client note.  The report also coincided with Wedbush analyst downgrades of Pinterest and software firm Nice Systems to neutral, from prior outperform ratings for both.
